intro: Matricaria anthemoides, commonly known as the common chamomile, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its daisy-like yellow flowers with white ray florets. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm and has finely divided, fern-like leaves. Its flowers bloom in the summer months and are used in herbal teas and traditional medicine for their calming properties. The essential oil extracted from its flowers contains compounds like bisabolol and chamazulene, which contribute to its therapeutic effects.
